meanings.definition: Infection by a disease agent to which the individual has previously been exposed and has developed immunity.
meanings.sent1: After getting sick once, the reinfection made him feel unwell again.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that reinfection can occur if the immune system weakens.
meanings.sent3: The reinfection seemed like a mischievous bug trying to sneak back in.
meanings.sent4: Her cough lingered like a stubborn reinfection that refused to go away.
meanings.sent5: The concept of reinfection was like a puzzle, with the same bug returning to cause trouble.

meanings.definition: The act or process of infecting again.
meanings.sent1: The reinfection of the wound delayed the healing process.
meanings.sent2: Proper hygiene can help prevent reinfection of the same area.
meanings.sent3: The reinfection of the computer virus was frustrating for the IT team.
meanings.sent4: The reinfection of negativity in her mind needed to be replaced with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The constant reinfection of rumors in the small town spread like wildfire.
